greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers induced when A245821 is restricted to nonprime numbers: a(n) = A062298(A245821(A018252(n))).
comment: This permutation is induced when A245821 is restricted to nonprimes, A018252, the first column of A114537, but equally, when it is restricted to column 2 (A007821), column 3 (A049078), etc. of that square array, or alternatively, to the successive rows of A236542.
The sequence of fixed points f(n) begins as 1, 2, 15, 142, 548, 1694, 54681. A018252(f(n)) gives the nonprime terms of A245823.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
Also following holds for all n >= 1:
program: isA014580(n)=polisirreducible(Pol(binary(n))*Mod(1, 2)); \\ This function from _Charles R Greathouse IV_
A002808(n)={my(k); for(k=0, primepi(n), isprime(n++)&&k--); n}; \\ This function from _M. F. Hasler_

A091205(n) = if(n<=1, n, if(isA014580(n), prime(A091205(A091226(n))), {my(irfs, t); irfs=subst(lift(factor(Mod(1, 2)*Pol(binary(n)))), x, 2); irfs[,1]=apply(t->A091205(t), irfs[,1]); factorback(irfs)}));
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 02 2014
